title: Labour shortage: Is Santa Claus coming to town this year?
description: With fewer Santas donning their suits and more demand for holiday cheer, Santa will be in short supply.

title: Video appears to show UK F-35 fighter crash after take-off
description: Dramatic footage of what appears to be a jet crashing off the aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth was posted on Twitter.

title: Ballon d'Or 2021: Watch Lionel Messi win record seventh trophy
description: Watch the moment Paris St-Germain and Argentina forward Lionel Messi wins a record seventh Ballon d'Or, beating Robert Lewandowski and Jorginho.

title: Signs life is returning to normal at I’m A Celeb
description: Live episodes are set to return on Tuesday after damage was caused to the set by Storm Arwen.

title: Nicola Sturgeon: The first minister's conference speech fact-checked
description: Scotland's first minister delivered her keynote address at the SNP party conference.

title: Paralysed Tylicki sues fellow jockey Gibbons for £6m over fall
description: Former Flat jockey Freddy Tylicki's £6m negligence claim against fellow rider Graham Gibbons begins in the High Court.

title: Virgil Abloh: How he 'helped black people dream in fashion'
description: Radio 1 Newsbeat has been speaking to people about the legacy Virgil Abloh leaves behind.

title: Matiu Ratana: Memorial held for Met Police sergeant shot dead
description: A memorial service to Sgt Matiu Ratana, delayed for a year by the pandemic, is held in Westminster.

title: Covid in Scotland: 'Test much more' plea after Omicron cases found
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon calls for increased compliance with measures to stop the spread of the virus.

title: SNP conference: Scottish child payment to double to £20 from April
description: Nicola Sturgeon tells the SNP conference that eradicating child poverty is "essential" to Scotland's future.

title: Magdalena Andersson: Sweden's first female PM returns after resignation
description: Magdalena Andersson is backed by MPs again, despite standing down last week hours into the job.

title: Covid: JCVI scientists to announce decision on booster rollout
description: A reduction in time between doses and extending the scheme to younger age groups could be approved.

title: Storm Arwen: Third night of no power for thousands
description: Energy firms say the storm caused "catastrophic damage" three times greater than that caused by the Beast from the East.

title: Sir Keir Starmer begins reshuffle of Labour shadow cabinet
description: Deputy Angela Rayner says she doesn't "know the details", as the Labour leader reorganises his frontbench.

title: Khan and Brook to fight in February
description: Amir Khan will take on fellow former world champion Kell Brook in Manchester on 19 February.

title: Manchester United appoint Ralf Rangnick as interim manager
description: Manchester United announce the appointment of Ralf Rangnick as their interim manager until the end of the season, subject to work visa requirements.

title: Covid: Omicron variant causes passengers to scramble for flights
description: One traveller told the BBC he had found an alternative flight home, but he faces extra costs of £4,000.

title: Odell Beckham, Fournette, & Jared Cook in NFL plays of the week
description: Odell Beckham Jr scores his first touchdown for the LA Rams and there are pick sixes galore in week 12's NFL plays of the week.

title: Storm Arwen: Trapped Tan Hill Inn guests leave
description: The Tan Hill Inn manager says the experience and their guests were "wonderful".

title: Last-wicket pair deny India as New Zealand secure thrilling draw
description: New Zealand bat out the whole of day five to dramatically survive with a draw in the first Test against India.

title: Ava White: Boy, 14, in court accused of girl's murder in Liverpool
description: The teenager is charged with murdering 12-year-old Ava White, who was stabbed in Liverpool.

title: Radio 4's Today programme temporarily drops off air
description: The BBC show went silent on Monday morning when a fire alarm told people to leave the building.

title: Queen of Barbados - but just for one last day
description: The island nation will remove Queen Elizabeth as head of state and swear in its first Barbadian president.

title: Williams falls asleep during UK Championship defeat
description: Three-time world champion Mark Williams falls asleep in his chair during a surprise second-round defeat by Anthony Hamilton in the UK Championship.

title: The 'map nerds' who are building a national archive
description: Thousands of volunteers capture images across Britain and Ireland as part of a project called Geograph.

title: Does Nicola Sturgeon's legacy rely on indyref2?
description: Nicola Sturgeon still aims to deliver independence - but is her legacy as first minister secure even without it?

title: Matiu Ratana: Colleagues pay tribute to 'inspiring' officer
description: The memorial service for an officer murdered in the line of duty in Croydon took place on Monday.

title: The Papers: Boosters 'for all adults' amid 'fight to save Xmas'
description: Monday's front pages are dominated by the latest developments surrounding the Omicron variant.

title: Barbados prepares to cut ties with the Queen
description: Watch as we travel to the island to find out what Barbadians make of the move.

title: Madhya Pradesh: Man builds Taj Mahal replica home for wife
description: The 52-year-old said he constructed the scaled-down four-bedroom house as a “monument of love”.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell's sex-trafficking trial to begin in New York City
description: The UK socialite denies grooming girls for convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse.

title: Omicron: Is India ready for a third wave?
description: Experts say the government needs to first fulfil its promises to boost the public health system.

title: The underwater 'kites' generating electricity as they move
description: Tidal power generators that look like aircraft are being tested in the sea off the Faroe Islands.

title: Joseph Kabila and DR Congo's missing millions
description: Millions of dollars of public funds went through bank accounts of ex-President Joseph Kabila's allies, BBC Africa Eye reveals.

title: Venezuelan migrants seeking a new home in Chile
description: Tens of thousands of Venezuelans escaping poverty and violence at home are risking their lives to travel south to Chile.

title: Gay and Muslim: Family wanted to 'make me better'
description: Asad struggled with his mental health and suicidal thoughts when he came out to his religious family.

title: Emma Day murder: Sister of mother killed by ex calls for changes
description: The Met and the Child Maintenance Service admitted faults were made in the handling of Emma Day's case.

title: How Britain protects its nuclear material
description: This highly specialised team guards Britain's radioactive stockpiles.
